thread.title: Chip Kelly says Eagles still have complete confidence in Sam Bradford
thread.title_full: Chip Kelly says Eagles still have complete confidence in Sam Bradford

author: Eliot Shorr-Parks | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Chip Kelly says Eagles still have complete confidence in Sam Bradford
text:
Comments 
PHILADELPHIA -- As former Phillies great Mike Schmidt once said, Philadelphia is the one place where you can experience the thrill of victory and the agony of reading about it the next day. 
A feeling Eagles quarterback Sam Bradford can likely relate to following his team's 27-7 win over the New York Giants on Monday night at Lincoln Financial Field. 
Despite his team taking home a 20-point win, Bradford did not play well, l eading some to question if the team could soon be making a quarterback change. 
Speaking Tuesday at the NovaCare Complex, Kelly strongly dismissed any thought of backup Mark Sanchez taking over. 
"Sam is our quarterback," Kelly said. "We have full confidence in Sam." 
It is fair to wonder if Kelly feels that way behind closed doors, as Bradford went 24 of 38 for 280 yards, one touchdown and three interceptions for a quarterback rating of 61.3 against the Giants. BRADFORD: QB's play could keep Eagles out of playoffs 
The three interceptions Bradford threw against the Giants brings his total up to nine on the season. 
"It is something that I never really had a problem with in my career," Bradford said after the game. "I have never thrown a lot of interceptions, so this is kind of new to me. But we're going to get it fixed. I am going to get it fixed." THE NO-HUDDLE SHOW, Ep. 11: Finally, a glimpse of what Eagles fans expected 
There were plenty of encouraging signs in the Eagles' blowout win over the Saints. From Fletcher Cox's dominance to Josh Huff's emergence, the Eagles showed what they're capable of doing. Now the question is: Can they do it again vs. the Giants? Subscribe to the podcast on iTunes or Stitcher . 
Eliot Shorr-Parks may be reached at eshorrpa@njadvancemedia.com . Follow him on Twitter @EliotShorrParks . Find NJ.com Sports on Facebook.
